author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Madras High Court Bench here on Friday reserved its judgement on former Agriculture Minister ‘Agri’ S.S. Krishnamoorthy’s plea to quash an abetment to suicide-cum-corruption case registered against him following the death of Assistant Executive Engineer Muthukumarasamy of Agricultural Engineering Department committed suicide on February 20 last.

Justice V.S. Ravi deferred his verdict without mentioning a date after hearing arguments advanced by the counsel for the petitioner as well as the prosecution.

According to the CB-CID, the engineer had jumped before a speeding train since he was unable to bear pressure exerted on him by his superiors to pay Rs.12.25 lakh to the petitioner for having appointed seven drivers in the department.
title: Verdict reserved in ‘Agri’ Krishnamoorthy’s case
